pull.title: Separate core memory usage computation in core_memusage.h
pull.body:
Remove support for computing recursive memory usage from memusage.h, making it more easy to plug in other functions.

Furthermore, move the computation of memory usage of core data structures from primitives/*, to reduce its dependencies, specifically on boost.

Should fix #6441.

issue.title: Limited mempool + floating relay fee + rejection caching + mempool expiry
issue.body:
This is a demo combination of #6452, #6421, #6453 and a new gradual relay fee adjustment.

Continuously (every second) adjust the relay fee by measuring the mempool size and correcting it towards 71% (sqrt(50%)) of the cap size. The maximum correction speed is equal to doubling or halving the fee per two hours. The relay fee will never go below the -minrelayfee setting. It is not intended to deal with sudden spikes - that's what the hard cap is meant for.

This was inspired by Jeff Garzik's low/high water mark approach, but has more gradual effects.

TODO: integration with fee estimation. @morcos, feel like having a look at that?

events.body: utACK, looks like the good solution to me

events.message: Separate core memory usage computation in core_memusage.h

issue.title: Bitcoin 0.12 mempool memory usage PRs
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#6410
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6453
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6013 (excludes changes to docs we deleted)

Part of #2074.
